comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Madame Domicio Da Gama (1870-1937), born Elizabeth Belle Bates in Texas, married first to Albert Volck, second to Arthur A. Hearn, third to Brazilian ambassador Domicio Da Gama; she had two sons, Morris Roderick Volck (1888-1934), and Adelbert George Volck (1886-1974). Their grandfather was the Civil War illustrator, Adelbert J. Volck (1828-1905). Given the ages of her sons, his child might be a grandson (she had a number of them). A. George Volck was a Hollywood agent, with Lillian Gish as one of his clients. Here's her tombstone, as Elizabeth Bell "Lizzie" Bates Volck Hearn Da Gama: www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=36141128

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: pennylrichardsca:  Thanks for Da Gama's full name information and dates.  We'll include this information next time we update the description.
